Class RegexUtil

java.lang.Object
  RegexUtil
public class RegexUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Provides general File regex Utilities. Allows clients to search and update files.

searchFile

public static java.util.Map searchFile(java.lang.String file,
                                       java.lang.String searchPattern,
                                       int flags)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Searches the specified File, and returns substrings that match the given pattern as an Map. if the pattern doesn't have any punctuation in it, then it's assumed that the user intended to capture the entire line of that match

Returns:
Map of found Strings. The key to the map is the position at which the element was found(as a String). the value is the actual text. If there are no matches, an empty Map is returned.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there's an IO error

searchDirs

public static java.util.Collection searchDirs(java.io.File currentFile,
                                              java.lang.String fileExtension,
                                              java.lang.String searchPattern,
                                              int regexFlags,
                                              boolean searchSubDirectories)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Search down through the given directory, and finds the specified Files, based the searchPattern, which describes it's content. Returns matching Files in an ArrayList. This methods searches reclusively through the file system.

Parameters:
searchSubDirectories - true if sub directories should be searched
Returns:
ArrayList containing File objects, or an empty ArrayList, if no matches are found
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there's an IO problem

searchDirs

public static java.util.Collection searchDirs(java.io.File currentFile,
                                              java.lang.String filePattern,
                                              boolean searchSubDirectories)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Search through the down the given directory, and finds the specified Files, based the searchPattern, which describes it's content. Returns matching Files in an ArrayList. This methods searches reclusively through the file system.

Returns:
ArrayList containing File objects, or an empty ArrayList, if no matches are found
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there's an IO problem

searchDirs

                                              boolean isRegex)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException

searchString

public static java.util.Map searchString(java.lang.String content,
                                         java.lang.String searchPattern,
                                         int flags)
Searches the specified String, and returns substrings that match the given pattern as an Map. The key to the map is the position at which the element was found(as a String). the value is the actual text. If there are no matches, an empty Map is returned.

Returns:
Map of found Strings. Empty if no matches are found.

updateFileContent

public static boolean updateFileContent(java.lang.String fileName,
                                        java.lang.String regex,
                                        java.lang.String replacement)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
updates the content of the file. By default, the Pattern.MULTILINE is used. Also supports the $d notation in the replacement string, per the Matcher.replaceAll method

Returns:
boolean true if the file was updated
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an IO error

getFileContent

public static java.lang.String getFileContent(java.lang.String fileName)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
extracts the content of a file

Returns:
String representing the contents of the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getProperty

public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String regexFile,
                                           java.lang.String key)
extracts the given property from the regex file

Returns:
String the key, or null if the file is not found. or if the key was empty.

findSpecificFile

public static java.io.File findSpecificFile(java.io.File dir,
                                            java.lang.String fName)
Recusivly steps through the given directory to find the specified file. returns null if the file is not found

Returns:
File if found, or null
